description: From Medieval Latin embrocatus, past participle of Late Latin embrocare, from embrocha, from Ancient Greek ἐμβροχή (embrokhḗ, “lotion, fomentation”).

verbs.description: embrocate (third-person singular simple present embrocates, present participle embrocating, simple past and past participle embrocated)

entries.meaning: (medicine, transitive) To moisten and rub (a diseased part) with a liquid substance, as with spirit, oil, etc., by means of a cloth or sponge.
